title: Intro to AI & Machine Learning
description: Explore fundamental AI/ML concepts: neural networks, training algorithms, large language models, and generative AI.

steps.title: What is Artificial Intelligence?
steps.description: Introduction to AI and its relationship to machine learning.

conceptCard.title: AI is pattern recognition at scale
conceptCard.body: At its core, AI learns patterns from data. Machine learning is the method; the data is the teacher.

steps.title: Neural Networks
steps.description: Understand how neural networks learn from data.

conceptCard.title: Neural networks learn by adjusting weights
conceptCard.body: Like tuning thousands of knobs until the output matches what you expect — that's training.

steps.title: Training & Algorithms
steps.description: Learn how models are trained with gradient descent and backpropagation.

conceptCard.title: Training is iterative error correction
conceptCard.body: A model makes a prediction, measures how wrong it is, and adjusts — millions of times.

steps.title: Large Language Models
steps.description: Understand how LLMs like GPT and Claude work.

conceptCard.title: LLMs predict the next token
conceptCard.body: Large language models are trained to predict what comes next in a sequence — and that simple objective produces remarkably capable systems.

steps.title: Generative AI
steps.description: Explore how AI generates text, images, and code.

conceptCard.title: Generative models learn the distribution of data
conceptCard.body: Instead of classifying inputs, generative models learn to produce new outputs that resemble the training data.

steps.title: AI Ethics & Limitations
steps.description: Understand the limitations, biases, and ethical considerations of AI systems.
steps.reflectionPrompt: What is one potential risk of AI systems that concerns you, and how might it be mitigated?

steps.title: AI Meets Web3
steps.description: Explore the intersection of AI and decentralized systems.

conceptCard.title: Decentralization can make AI more transparent
conceptCard.body: Storing model outputs and training data provenance on-chain creates verifiable AI — you can check what the model saw and said.

steps.title: Knowledge Check
steps.description: Test your understanding of AI and machine learning fundamentals.

questions.question: What is the relationship between AI and machine learning?
options: Machine learning is a subset of AI
AI is a subset of machine learning
questions.correctAnswer: Machine learning is a subset of AI
questions.explanation: Machine learning is one approach to achieving AI. AI is the broader field; ML is a specific technique within it.

questions.question: What does a neural network adjust during training?
questions.explanation: During training, a neural network adjusts its weights and biases to minimize the error between its predictions and the correct answers.

questions.question: What is the core training objective of a large language model?
options: Predict the next token in a sequence
questions.correctAnswer: Predict the next token in a sequence
questions.explanation: LLMs are fundamentally trained on next-token prediction. Instruction-following and reasoning emerge from this objective at scale.

questions.question: True or False: Generative AI creates entirely new data that has no relationship to its training data.
questions.explanation: Generative AI produces outputs that follow the patterns and distributions learned from training data. It doesn't create from nothing — it interpolates and recombines learned patterns.

questions.question: What is gradient descent?
options: An optimization algorithm that minimizes error by adjusting parameters
questions.correctAnswer: An optimization algorithm that minimizes error by adjusting parameters
questions.explanation: Gradient descent iteratively adjusts model parameters in the direction that reduces the error (loss function).

questions.question: What is a key limitation of current AI systems?
options: They can reproduce and amplify biases present in training data
questions.correctAnswer: They can reproduce and amplify biases present in training data
questions.explanation: AI systems learn from data, and if the data contains biases, the model will learn and potentially amplify those biases.

questions.question: How can decentralized systems (Web3) complement AI?
options: By providing verifiable provenance for training data and model outputs
By removing the need for training data
questions.correctAnswer: By providing verifiable provenance for training data and model outputs
questions.explanation: On-chain records can track what data a model was trained on and what it produced, creating transparency and auditability.

badge.name: AI Fundamentals
badge.description: Completed the Intro to AI & Machine Learning track and demonstrated understanding of neural networks, LLMs, and generative AI.
